data.scheme_name: Madhya Pradesh Startup Policy and Implementation Scheme 2022 - Product based startups - Exemption on Electricity Duty
data.benefits: All eligible new units with a new electricity connection will be exempt from electricity duty for three years from the date of connection.
data.eligibility: Startups should be recognized under DPIIT and established in the state of Madhya Pradesh shall be eligible under this scheme.
data.beneficiaries: Start-up should have received funds/investments from a financial institution recognized by SEBI (Security and Exchange Board of India)/RBI.
data.prerequisites:
1. Startup should be recognized by Startup India under the Government of India, Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade, and is established and registered in the State of Madhya Pradesh. 
  2. It should be units having new electricity connection.
data.nodal_agency: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
data.context: This policy aims to create a supportive ecosystem for startups, fostering innovation, entrepreneurship, and economic growth in the state.
data.objective: The main objective of the Madhya Pradesh Startup Policy is to foster innovation and entrepreneurship to drive economic growth and job creation.
data.description:
1. All eligible new units with a new electricity connection will be exempt from electricity duty for three years from the date of connection.
  2. Electricity Tariff Concession: New electricity connections for projects will be supplied at a fixed rate of 5 per unit for three years from the date of commercial production.
data.how_to_apply: Startups who have successfully logged in to MP startup portal can apply on for financial assistance on the Portal itself, with all the relevant documents: https://startup.mp.gov.in/
data.funding_facilitator: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
data.funding_mechanism: This assistance will be payable at the rate of 15% separately for each of the investments received over a maximum of four stages during the life of the start-up.
data.additional_info: “Startup” means an entity which is recognized by Startup India under the Government of India, Ministry of Commerce and Industry Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade, and is established and registered in the State of Madhya Pradesh.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. KYC Documents
2. Financials
3. UDYAM registration certificate
4. Start up recognition certificate from GOI, Ministry of commerce and Industry
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: First Floor GTB Complex, Infront of Bank of Maharashtra, Roshanpura Square,Bhopal (M.P) 462004, Madhya Pradesh

Contact: +91 755 35 24017

Email: startup-centre@mp.gov.in
data.beneficiary: Specific Manufacturing Industries - Private Limited Company, Partnership, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) - Madhya Pradesh - All MSMEs
